reasoning: Facet joint arthrosis is a chronic degenerative condition; prevalence is appropriate metric. Imaging studies suggest 25-50% prevalence in adults >40 years, averaging ~25% of global population (25,000 per 100k). Limited disease-specific epidemiological data; confidence capped at moderate due to reliance on imaging studies without standardized diagnostic criteria across populations.
